result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Rabideau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA surcharge to be assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 1:10 pm caes called. Defendant Jesse A. Rabideau in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by counsel-no material additions or corrections. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: Count 2- 7 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. To begin no later than April 1, 2016. No objection to jail transfer. CONDITIONS on EACH COUNT:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Full time Employment. Terms of Agent. Costs to include $820 drug buy reimbursement money, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA surcharge to be assessed on each count. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 03-10-2016 01:00 pm
from Atty Zamzow requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court
Sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 01:30 pm

10:28 am case called. Defendant Jesse A. Rabideau in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader states an agreement has been reached and a PSI will be completed. Agreement stated on record by DA Blader. Attorney Zamzow concurs. Preliminary hearing discussed. Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Defendant enters pleas.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Counts 2 & 3.   Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC and orders a PSI to be completed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 01-05-2016 10:30 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zamzow requests Plea/Sentencing.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Zamzow requesting a plea hearing

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zamzow states she has received an offer and requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:25 am.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Jesse A. Rabideau in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  DA argues for $2000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Atty Zamzow states no objection to bond request.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:05 am.
